alert.note: Alert for Barry; Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 4:06PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry and Stone. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 405 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Kimberling City, Silver Dollar City, Reeds Spring, Seligman, Indian Point, Branson West and Washburn.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
